New Records: Pakistan secured a comprehensive 81-run victory against a battling Netherlands to kickstart their World Cup campaign.
Saud Shakeel and Muhammad Rizwan saw them recover to post 286 after 49 overs.
Netherlands started brightly in their chase as Bas de Leede and Vikram Singh both reached their half-centuries as part of a 70-run stand.
Key Match Events: Pakistan wobbled a bit with the bat at the start but they showed all their skill with the ball to run through the Netherlands and secure a healthy win which will aid their net run-rate tremendously.
The Dutch middle order failed to provide support for De Leede who eventually fell for 67, with Scott Edwards' side losing their last 8 wickets for 85 runs as they were bowled out for 205.
Bas de Leede and Vikram Singh both reached their half-centuries as part of a 70-run stand.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan captain, Babar Azam, speaking after his side’s win: ‘The way Hyderabad have supported [us], we’re very happy and the team has enjoyed their hospitality.’
Post-Match Reflections: Saud Shakeel, player of the match, speaking after the match: ‘I was very pleased with my performance. I tried to follow my basics and be positive and score runs for the team.’
Netherlands captain, Scott Edwards, speaking after the game: ‘It is probably one that got away - we were in a pretty good position to win that.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weekend also sees the mouthwatering fixture between India and Australia - what a fixture that promises to be on Sunday
Netherlands have a tricky fixture on Monday against New Zealand, who thumped England on opening day.
Others: Pakistan get their World Cup up and running with a convincing 81-run victory over the Netherlands
